Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown; two added red bands near bottom of sherd; exterior reserved with dilute band at bottom of sherd; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ5
Curator's comments: 'Φ5' marked in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0938) (phase 2)
